qas.question: How many parades take place during Carnival?
Who rides through the city on a carriage?
Which of the festivals is comprised of participants who are mainly children?
What do people walk along the town's longest avenue in?
Who are the last two parades open for participation by?

context: <a0_0>Three<a0_0/> main parades take place during Carnival. The first is held on the first day, during which <a1_0>the "Carnival King<a1_0/>" (either a person in costume or an effigy) rides through the city on his carriage. <a2_0>The second<a2_0/> is held on the first Sunday of the festival and the participants are mainly children. The third and largest takes place on the last day of Carnival and involves hundreds of people walking in <a3_0>costume<a3_0/> along the town's longest avenue. The latter two parades are open to <a4_0>anyone who wishes to participate<a4_0/>.
